DataElement.preferredName: Muscularis Propria Tumor Cell Invasion Present Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator to signify whether or not an invasion of muscularis propria is present.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Muscularis Propria Tumor Cell Invasion Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The detrusor muscle of the bladder, forming the muscular wall of the bladder, consisting of the inner longitudinal; middle circular; and outer longitudinal layers._Local spread of a malignant neoplasm by infiltration or destruction of adjacent tissue; for epithelial neoplasms, invasion signifies infiltration beneath the epithelial basement membrane._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The detrusor muscle of the bladder, forming the muscular wall of the bladder, consisting of the inner longitudinal; middle circular; and outer longitudinal layers.

Concepts.definition: The detrusor muscle of the bladder, forming the muscular wall of the bladder, consisting of the inner longitudinal; middle circular; and outer longitudinal layers.

Property.preferredDefinition: Local spread of a malignant neoplasm by infiltration or destruction of adjacent tissue; for epithelial neoplasms, invasion signifies infiltration beneath the epithelial basement membrane.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: The local spread of tumor cells of a malignant neoplasm through infiltration or destruction of adjacent tissue; for epithelial neoplasms, invasion signifies infiltration beneath the epithelial basement membrane.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for TCGA Bladder EPC per request by J.Demchok. mc 1/31/13 Released per approval by John. mc 3/20/13

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
